alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 1:52PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Amelia and central Powhatan Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 152 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Macon, or near Powhatan, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Powhatan, Macon, Goodwins Store, Flat Rock, Fine Creek Mills, Michaux, Jefferson, Belona, Lake Powhatan, Giles Mill, Subletts and Worshams. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
